page.title: 05SOIL TYPE/FARM SIZE
page.content: {Soil type}-typical of the drier lowlands with significant summer moisture deficit. Deep soil, no hard rock or other layer impenetrable to roots at less than 50cms. Medium and heavy textured silt loams. {Farm size}In Holland area of Lincs. average farm size has risen from 43 hectares in 1950-52 to 146 hectares in 1981-83. This is supported by Eastern Counties average figures showing 44390 holdings in 1959 with 2.9% being over 200 hectares. By 1983 20044 holdings with 10% over 200 hectares. {Livestock} Very little livestock raised in the area. However there is a shepherd with a mobile flock which he drives from farm to farm fattening lambs on crop residues.
